    5153             : 
    5154             :     template<typename DerivedT>
    5155             :     struct CumulativeReporterBase : IStreamingReporter {
    5156             :         template<typename T, typename ChildNodeT>
    5157             :         struct Node {
    5158           0 :             explicit Node( T const& _value ) : value( _value ) {}
    5159           0 :             virtual ~Node() {}
    5160             : 
    5161             :             using ChildNodes = std::vector<std::shared_ptr<ChildNodeT>>;
    5162             :             T value;
    5163             :             ChildNodes children;
    5164             :         };
    5165             :         struct SectionNode {
    5166           0 :             explicit SectionNode(SectionStats const& _stats) : stats(_stats) {}
    5167           0 :             virtual ~SectionNode() = default;
    5168             : 
    5169             :             bool operator == (SectionNode const& other) const {
    5170             :                 return stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == other.stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo;
    5171             :             }
    5172             :             bool operator == (std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> const& other) const {
    5173             :                 return operator==(*other);
    5174             :             }
    5175             : 
    5176             :             SectionStats stats;
    5177             :             using ChildSections = std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>>;
    5178             :             using Assertions = std::vector<AssertionStats>;
    5179             :             ChildSections childSections;
    5180             :             Assertions assertions;
    5181             :             std::string stdOut;
    5182             :             std::string stdErr;
    5183             :         };
    5184             : 
    5185             :         struct BySectionInfo {
    5186           0 :             BySectionInfo( SectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other ) {}
    5187           0 :             BySectionInfo( BySectionInfo const& other ) : m_other( other.m_other ) {}
    5188           0 :             bool operator() (std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> const& node) const {
    5189           0 :                 return ((node->stats.sectionInfo.name == m_other.name) &&
    5190           0 :                         (node->stats.sectionInfo.lineInfo == m_other.lineInfo));
    5191             :             }
    5192             :             void operator=(BySectionInfo const&) = delete;
    5193             : 
    5194             :         private:
    5195             :             SectionInfo const& m_other;
    5196             :         };
    5197             : 
    5198             :         using TestCaseNode = Node<TestCaseStats, SectionNode>;
    5199             :         using TestGroupNode = Node<TestGroupStats, TestCaseNode>;
    5200             :         using TestRunNode = Node<TestRunStats, TestGroupNode>;
    5201             : 
    5202           0 :         CumulativeReporterBase( ReporterConfig const& _config )
    5203             :         :   m_config( _config.fullConfig() ),
    5204           0 :             stream( _config.stream() )
    5205             :         {
    5206           0 :             m_reporterPrefs.shouldRedirectStdOut = false;
    5207           0 :             if( !DerivedT::getSupportedVerbosities().count( m_config->verbosity() ) )
    5208           0 :                 CATCH_ERROR( "Verbosity level not supported by this reporter" );
    5209           0 :         }
    5210           0 :         ~CumulativeReporterBase() override = default;
    5211             : 
    5212           0 :         ReporterPreferences getPreferences() const override {
    5213           0 :             return m_reporterPrefs;
    5214             :         }
    5215             : 
    5216           0 :         static std::set<Verbosity> getSupportedVerbosities() {
    5217           0 :             return { Verbosity::Normal };
    5218             :         }
    5219             : 
    5220           0 :         void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& ) override {}
    5221           0 :         void testGroupStarting( GroupInfo const& ) override {}
    5222             : 
    5223           0 :         void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& ) override {}
    5224             : 
    5225           0 :         void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) override {
    5226           0 :             SectionStats incompleteStats( sectionInfo, Counts(), 0, false );
    5227           0 :             std::shared_ptr<SectionNode> node;
    5228           0 :             if( m_sectionStack.empty() ) {
    5229           0 :                 if( !m_rootSection )
    5230           0 :                     m_rootSection = std::make_shared<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    5231           0 :                 node = m_rootSection;
    5232             :             }
    5233             :             else {
    5234           0 :                 SectionNode& parentNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    5235             :                 auto it =
    5236           0 :                     std::find_if(   parentNode.childSections.begin(),
    5237             :                                     parentNode.childSections.end(),
    5238           0 :                                     BySectionInfo( sectionInfo ) );
    5239           0 :                 if( it == parentNode.childSections.end() ) {
    5240           0 :                     node = std::make_shared<SectionNode>( incompleteStats );
    5241           0 :                     parentNode.childSections.push_back( node );
    5242             :                 }
    5243             :                 else
    5244           0 :                     node = *it;
    5245             :             }
    5246           0 :             m_sectionStack.push_back( node );
    5247           0 :             m_deepestSection = std::move(node);
    5248           0 :         }
    5249             : 
    5250           0 :         void assertionStarting(AssertionInfo const&) override {}
    5251             : 
    5252           0 :         bool assertionEnded(AssertionStats const& assertionStats) override {
    5253           0 :             assert(!m_sectionStack.empty());
    5254             :             // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    5255             :             // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    5256             :             // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    5257             :             // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    5258             :             // a destroyed object later.
    5259           0 :             prepareExpandedExpression(const_cast<AssertionResult&>( assertionStats.assertionResult ) );
    5260           0 :             SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    5261           0 :             sectionNode.assertions.push_back(assertionStats);
    5262           0 :             return true;
    5263             :         }
    5264           0 :         void sectionEnded(SectionStats const& sectionStats) override {
    5265           0 :             assert(!m_sectionStack.empty());
    5266           0 :             SectionNode& node = *m_sectionStack.back();
    5267           0 :             node.stats = sectionStats;
    5268           0 :             m_sectionStack.pop_back();
    5269           0 :         }
    5270           0 :         void testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats) override {
    5271           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestCaseNode>(testCaseStats);
    5272           0 :             assert(m_sectionStack.size() == 0);
    5273           0 :             node->children.push_back(m_rootSection);
    5274           0 :             m_testCases.push_back(node);
    5275           0 :             m_rootSection.reset();
    5276             : 
    5277           0 :             assert(m_deepestSection);
    5278           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdOut = testCaseStats.stdOut;
    5279           0 :             m_deepestSection->stdErr = testCaseStats.stdErr;
    5280           0 :         }
    5281           0 :         void testGroupEnded(TestGroupStats const& testGroupStats) override {
    5282           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestGroupNode>(testGroupStats);
    5283           0 :             node->children.swap(m_testCases);
    5284           0 :             m_testGroups.push_back(node);
    5285           0 :         }
    5286           0 :         void testRunEnded(TestRunStats const& testRunStats) override {
    5287           0 :             auto node = std::make_shared<TestRunNode>(testRunStats);
    5288           0 :             node->children.swap(m_testGroups);
    5289           0 :             m_testRuns.push_back(node);
    5290           0 :             testRunEndedCumulative();
    5291           0 :         }
    5292             :         virtual void testRunEndedCumulative() = 0;
    5293             : 
    5294           0 :         void skipTest(TestCaseInfo const&) override {}
    5295             : 
    5296             :         IConfigPtr m_config;
    5297             :         std::ostream& stream;
    5298             :         std::vector<AssertionStats> m_assertions;
    5299             :         std::vector<std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>>> m_sections;

    5301             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<TestGroupNode>> m_testGroups;
    5302             :

    5307             :         std::vector<std::shared_ptr<SectionNode>> m_sectionStack;
    5308             :         ReporterPreferences m_reporterPrefs;
    5309             :     };
    5310             : 
    5311             :     template<char C>
    5312           0 :     char const* getLineOfChars() {
    5313             :         static char line[CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH] = {0};
    5314           0 :         if( !*line ) {
    5315           0 :             std::memset( line, C, CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 );
    5316           0 :             line[CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1] = 0;
    5317             :         }
    5318           0 :         return line;
    5319             :     }

    5784          36 :     struct ITracker {

    5791             :         virtual bool isComplete() const = 0; // Successfully completed or failed

    5925             : // Cpp files will be included in the single-header file here
    5926             : // start catch_approx.cpp
    5927             : 
    5928             : #include <cmath>
    5929             : #include <limits>
    5930             : 
    5931             : namespace {
    5932             : 
    5933             : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
    5934             : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
    5935           0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
    5936           0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
    5937             : }
    5938             : 
    5939             : }
    5940             : 
    5941             : namespace Catch {
    5942             : namespace Detail {
    5943             : 
    5944           0 :     Approx::Approx ( double value )
    5945           0 :     :   m_epsilon( std::numeric_limits<float>::epsilon()*100 ),
    5946             :         m_margin( 0.0 ),
    5947             :         m_scale( 0.0 ),
    5948           0 :         m_value( value )
    5949           0 :     {}
    5950             : 
    5951           0 :     Approx Approx::custom() {
    5952           0 :         return Approx( 0 );
    5953             :     }
    5954             : 
    5955           0 :     Approx Approx::operator-() const {
    5956           0 :         auto temp(*this);
    5957           0 :         temp.m_value = -temp.m_value;
    5958           0 :         return temp;
    5959             :     }
    5960             : 
    5961           0 :     std::string Approx::toString() const {
    5962           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
    5963           0 :         rss << "Approx( " << ::Catch::Detail::stringify( m_value ) << " )";
    5964           0 :         return rss.str();
    5965             :     }
    5966             : 
    5967           0 :     bool Approx::equalityComparisonImpl(const double other) const {
    5968             :         // First try with fixed margin, then compute margin based on epsilon, scale and Approx's value
    5969             :         // Thanks to Richard Harris for his help refining the scaled margin value
    5970           0 :         return marginComparison(m_value, other, m_margin) || marginComparison(m_value, other, m_epsilon * (m_scale + std::fabs(m_value)));
    5971             :     }
    5972             : 
    5973           0 :     void Approx::setMargin(double margin) {
    5974           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(margin >= 0,
    5975             :             "Invalid Approx::margin: " << margin << '.'
    5976             :             << " Approx::Margin has to be non-negative.");
    5977           0 :         m_margin = margin;
    5978           0 :     }
    5979             : 
    5980           0 :     void Approx::setEpsilon(double epsilon) {
    5981           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(epsilon >= 0 && epsilon <= 1.0,
    5982             :             "Invalid Approx::epsilon: " << epsilon << '.'
    5983             :             << " Approx::epsilon has to be in [0, 1]");
    5984           0 :         m_epsilon = epsilon;
    5985           0 :     }
    5986             : 
    5987             : } // end namespace Detail
    5988             : 
    5989             : namespace literals {
    5990           0 :     Detail::Approx operator "" _a(long double val) {
    5991           0 :         return Detail::Approx(val);
    5992             :     }
    5993           0 :     Detail::Approx operator "" _a(unsigned long long val) {
    5994           0 :         return Detail::Approx(val);
    5995             :     }
    5996             : } // end namespace literals
    5997             : 
    5998           0 : std::string StringMaker<Catch::Detail::Approx>::convert(Catch::Detail::Approx const& value) {
    5999           0 :     return value.toString();
    6000             : }
    6001             : 
    6002             : } // end namespace Catch

    6006             : // start catch_debugger.h
    6007             : 
    6008             : namespace Catch {
    6009             :     bool isDebuggerActive();
    6010             : }
    6011             : 
    6012             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    6013             : 
    6014             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() __asm__("int $3\n" : : ) /* NOLINT */
    6015             : 
    6016             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    6017             :     // If we can use inline assembler, do it because this allows us to break
    6018             :     // directly at the location of the failing check instead of breaking inside
    6019             :     // raise() called from it, i.e. one stack frame below.
    6020             :     #if defined(__GNUC__) && (defined(__i386) || defined(__x86_64))
    6021             :         #define CATCH_TRAP() asm volatile ("int $3") /* NOLINT */
    6022             :     #else // Fall back to the generic way.
    6023             :         #include <signal.h>
    6024             : 
    6025             :         #define CATCH_TRAP() raise(SIGTRAP)
    6026             :     #endif
    6027             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    6028             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() __debugbreak()
    6029             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    6030             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) void __stdcall DebugBreak();
    6031             :     #define CATCH_TRAP() DebugBreak()
    6032             : #endif
    6033             : 
    6034             : #ifdef CATCH_TRAP
    6035             :     #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() []{ if( Catch::isDebuggerActive() ) { CATCH_TRAP(); } }()
    6036             : #else
    6037             :     #define CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER() []{}()
    6038             : #endif
    6039             : 
    6040             : // end catch_debugger.h

    6309          25 :     void AssertionHandler::complete() {
    6310          25 :         setCompleted();
    6311          25 :         if( m_reaction.shouldDebugBreak ) {
    6312             : 
    6313             :             // If you find your debugger stopping you here then go one level up on the
    6314             :             // call-stack for the code that caused it (typically a failed assertion)
    6315             : 
    6316             :             // (To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw, next)
    6317           0 :             CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
    6318             :         }
    6319          25 :         if (m_reaction.shouldThrow) {
    6320             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    6321           0 :             throw Catch::TestFailureException();
    6322             : #else
    6323             :             CATCH_ERROR( "Test failure requires aborting test!" );
    6324             : #endif
    6325             :         }
    6326          25 :     }

    6467             :         }

    6565           0 : inline auto isWhitespace(char c) -> bool {
    6566           0 :         static std::string chars = " \t\n\r";
    6567           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    6568             : }
    6569           0 : inline auto isBreakableBefore(char c) -> bool {
    6570           0 :         static std::string chars = "[({<|";
    6571           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    6572             : }
    6573           0 : inline auto isBreakableAfter(char c) -> bool {
    6574           0 :         static std::string chars = "])}>.,:;*+-=&/\\";
    6575           0 :         return chars.find(c) != std::string::npos;
    6576             : }
    6577             : 
    6578             : class Columns;
    6579             : 
    6580           0 : class Column {
    6581             :         std::vector<std::string> m_strings;
    6582             :         size_t m_width = CATCH_CLARA_TEXTFLOW_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH;
    6583             :         size_t m_indent = 0;
    6584             :         size_t m_initialIndent = std::string::npos;
    6585             : 
    6586             : public:
    6587             :         class iterator {
    6588             :                 friend Column;
    6589             : 
    6590             :                 Column const& m_column;
    6591             :                 size_t m_stringIndex = 0;
    6592             :                 size_t m_pos = 0;
    6593             : 
    6594             :                 size_t m_len = 0;
    6595             :                 size_t m_end = 0;
    6596             :                 bool m_suffix = false;
    6597             : 
    6598           0 :                 iterator(Column const& column, size_t stringIndex)
    6599             :                         : m_column(column),
    6600           0 :                         m_stringIndex(stringIndex) {}
    6601             : 
    6602           0 :                 auto line() const -> std::string const& { return m_column.m_strings[m_stringIndex]; }
    6603             : 
    6604           0 :                 auto isBoundary(size_t at) const -> bool {
    6605           0 :                         assert(at > 0);
    6606           0 :                         assert(at <= line().size());
    6607             : 
    6608           0 :                         return at == line().size() ||
    6609           0 :                                 (isWhitespace(line()[at]) && !isWhitespace(line()[at - 1])) ||
    6610           0 :                                 isBreakableBefore(line()[at]) ||
    6611           0 :                                 isBreakableAfter(line()[at - 1]);
    6612             :                 }
    6613             : 
    6614           0 :                 void calcLength() {
    6615           0 :                         assert(m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size());
    6616             : 
    6617           0 :                         m_suffix = false;
    6618           0 :                         auto width = m_column.m_width - indent();
    6619           0 :                         m_end = m_pos;
    6620           0 :                         while (m_end < line().size() && line()[m_end] != '\n')
    6621           0 :                                 ++m_end;
    6622             : 
    6623           0 :                         if (m_end < m_pos + width) {
    6624           0 :                                 m_len = m_end - m_pos;
    6625             :                         } else {
    6626           0 :                                 size_t len = width;
    6627           0 :                                 while (len > 0 && !isBoundary(m_pos + len))
    6628           0 :                                         --len;
    6629           0 :                                 while (len > 0 && isWhitespace(line()[m_pos + len - 1]))
    6630           0 :                                         --len;
    6631             : 
    6632           0 :                                 if (len > 0) {
    6633           0 :                                         m_len = len;
    6634             :                                 } else {
    6635           0 :                                         m_suffix = true;
    6636           0 :                                         m_len = width - 1;
    6637             :                                 }
    6638             :                         }
    6639           0 :                 }
    6640             : 
    6641           0 :                 auto indent() const -> size_t {
    6642           0 :                         auto initial = m_pos == 0 && m_stringIndex == 0 ? m_column.m_initialIndent : std::string::npos;
    6643           0 :                         return initial == std::string::npos ? m_column.m_indent : initial;
    6644             :                 }
    6645             : 
    6646           0 :                 auto addIndentAndSuffix(std::string const &plain) const -> std::string {
    6647           0 :                         return std::string(indent(), ' ') + (m_suffix ? plain + "-" : plain);
    6648             :                 }
    6649             : 
    6650             :         public:
    6651             :                 using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
    6652             :                 using value_type = std::string;
    6653             :                 using pointer = value_type * ;
    6654             :                 using reference = value_type & ;
    6655             :                 using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;
    6656             : 
    6657           0 :                 explicit iterator(Column const& column) : m_column(column) {
    6658           0 :                         assert(m_column.m_width > m_column.m_indent);
    6659           0 :                         assert(m_column.m_initialIndent == std::string::npos || m_column.m_width > m_column.m_initialIndent);
    6660           0 :                         calcLength();
    6661           0 :                         if (m_len == 0)
    6662           0 :                                 m_stringIndex++; // Empty string
    6663           0 :                 }
    6664             : 
    6665           0 :                 auto operator *() const -> std::string {
    6666           0 :                         assert(m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size());
    6667           0 :                         assert(m_pos <= m_end);
    6668           0 :                         return addIndentAndSuffix(line().substr(m_pos, m_len));
    6669             :                 }
    6670             : 
    6671           0 :                 auto operator ++() -> iterator& {
    6672           0 :                         m_pos += m_len;
    6673           0 :                         if (m_pos < line().size() && line()[m_pos] == '\n')
    6674           0 :                                 m_pos += 1;
    6675             :                         else
    6676           0 :                                 while (m_pos < line().size() && isWhitespace(line()[m_pos]))
    6677           0 :                                         ++m_pos;
    6678             : 
    6679           0 :                         if (m_pos == line().size()) {
    6680           0 :                                 m_pos = 0;
    6681           0 :                                 ++m_stringIndex;
    6682             :                         }
    6683           0 :                         if (m_stringIndex < m_column.m_strings.size())
    6684           0 :                                 calcLength();
    6685           0 :                         return *this;
    6686             :                 }
    6687             :                 auto operator ++(int) -> iterator {
    6688             :                         iterator prev(*this);
    6689             :                         operator++();
    6690             :                         return prev;
    6691             :                 }
    6692             : 
    6693           0 :                 auto operator ==(iterator const& other) const -> bool {
    6694             :                         return
    6695           0 :                                 m_pos == other.m_pos &&
    6696           0 :                                 m_stringIndex == other.m_stringIndex &&
    6697           0 :                                 &m_column == &other.m_column;
    6698             :                 }
    6699           0 :                 auto operator !=(iterator const& other) const -> bool {
    6700           0 :                         return !operator==(other);
    6701             :                 }
    6702             :         };
    6703             :         using const_iterator = iterator;
    6704             : 
    6705           0 :         explicit Column(std::string const& text) { m_strings.push_back(text); }
    6706             : 
    6707           0 :         auto width(size_t newWidth) -> Column& {
    6708           0 :                 assert(newWidth > 0);
    6709           0 :                 m_width = newWidth;

    6723           0 :         auto end() const -> iterator { return { *this, m_strings.size() }; }
    6724             : 
    6725           0 :         inline friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& os, Column const& col) {
    6726           0 :                 bool first = true;

    6728           0 :                         if (first)
    6729           0 :                                 first = false;
    6730             :                         else
    6731           0 :                                 os << "\n";
    6732           0 :                         os << line;
    6733             :                 }
    6734           0 :                 return os;
    6735             :         }

    6741             :                 oss << *this;
    6742             :                 return oss.str();

    6744             : };

    6754           0 : class Columns {

    6759           0 :         class iterator {

    6766             :

    6930             :     // Wraps a token coming from a token stream. These may not directly correspond to strings as a single string
    6931             :     // may encode an option + its argument if the : or = form is used
    6932             :     enum class TokenType {
    6933             :         Option, Argument
    6934             :     };
    6935           0 :     struct Token {
    6936             :         TokenType type;
    6937             :         std::string token;
    6938             :     };
    6939             : 
    6940           0 :     inline auto isOptPrefix( char c ) -> bool {
    6941           0 :         return c == '-'
    6942             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    6943             :             || c == '/'
    6944             : #endif
    6945             :         ;
    6946             :     }
    6947             : 
    6948             :     // Abstracts iterators into args as a stream of tokens, with option arguments uniformly handled
    6949           9 :     class TokenStream {
    6950             :         using Iterator = std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator;
    6951             :         Iterator it;
    6952             :         Iterator itEnd;
    6953             :         std::vector<Token> m_tokenBuffer;
    6954             : 
    6955           1 :         void loadBuffer() {
    6956           1 :             m_tokenBuffer.resize( 0 );
    6957             : 
    6958             :             // Skip any empty strings
    6959           1 :             while( it != itEnd && it->empty() )
    6960           0 :                 ++it;
    6961             : 
    6962           1 :             if( it != itEnd ) {
    6963           0 :                 auto const &next = *it;
    6964           0 :                 if( isOptPrefix( next[0] ) ) {
    6965           0 :                     auto delimiterPos = next.find_first_of( " :=" );
    6966           0 :                     if( delimiterPos != std::string::npos ) {
    6967           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next.substr( 0, delimiterPos ) } );
    6968           0 :                         m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next.substr( delimiterPos + 1 ) } );
    6969             :                     } else {
    6970           0 :                         if( next[1] != '-' && next.size() > 2 ) {
    6971           0 :                             std::string opt = "- ";
    6972           0 :                             for( size_t i = 1; i < next.size(); ++i ) {
    6973           0 :                                 opt[1] = next[i];
    6974           0 :                                 m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, opt } );
    6975             :                             }
    6976             :                         } else {
    6977           0 :                             m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Option, next } );
    6978             :                         }
    6979             :                     }
    6980             :                 } else {
    6981           0 :                     m_tokenBuffer.push_back( { TokenType::Argument, next } );
    6982             :                 }
    6983             :             }
    6984           1 :         }
    6985             : 
    6986             :     public:
    6987           1 :         explicit TokenStream( Args const &args ) : TokenStream( args.m_args.begin(), args.m_args.end() ) {}
    6988             : 
    6989           1 :         TokenStream( Iterator it, Iterator itEnd ) : it( it ), itEnd( itEnd ) {
    6990           1 :             loadBuffer();
    6991           1 :         }
    6992             : 
    6993           1 :         explicit operator bool() const {
    6994           1 :             return !m_tokenBuffer.empty() || it != itEnd;
    6995             :         }
    6996             : 
    6997             :         auto count() const -> size_t { return m_tokenBuffer.size() + (itEnd - it); }
    6998             : 
    6999           0 :         auto operator*() const -> Token {
    7000           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    7001           0 :             return m_tokenBuffer.front();
    7002             :         }
    7003             : 
    7004           0 :         auto operator->() const -> Token const * {
    7005           0 :             assert( !m_tokenBuffer.empty() );
    7006           0 :             return &m_tokenBuffer.front();
    7007             :         }
    7008             : 
    7009           0 :         auto operator++() -> TokenStream & {
    7010           0 :             if( m_tokenBuffer.size() >= 2 ) {
    7011           0 :                 m_tokenBuffer.erase( m_tokenBuffer.begin() );
    7012             :             } else {
    7013           0 :                 if( it != itEnd )
    7014           0 :                     ++it;
    7015           0 :                 loadBuffer();
    7016             :             }
    7017           0 :             return *this;
    7018             :         }
    7019             :     };

    7157           0 :         std::stringstream ss;
    7158           0 :         ss << source;
    7159           0 :         ss >> target;
    7160           0 :         if( ss.fail() )
    7161           0 :             return ParserResult::runtimeError( "Unable to convert '" + source + "' to destination type" );
    7162             :         else
    7163           0 :             return ParserResult::ok( ParseResultType::Matched );
    7164             :     }
    7165           1 :     inline auto convertInto( std::string const &source, std::string& target ) -> ParserResult {
    7166           1 :         target = source;
    7167           1 :         return ParserResult::ok( ParseResultType::Matched );
    7168             :     }
    7169           0 :     inline auto convertInto( std::string const &source, bool &target ) -> ParserResult {
    7170           0 :         std::string srcLC = source;
    7171           0 :         std::transform( srcLC.begin(), srcLC.end(), srcLC.begin(), []( char c ) { return static_cast<char>( std::tolower(c) ); } );

    7173           0 :             target = true;
    7174           0 :         else if (srcLC == "n" || srcLC == "0" || srcLC == "false" || srcLC == "no" || srcLC == "off")
    7175           0 :             target = false;
    7176             :         else
    7177           0 :             return ParserResult::runtimeError( "Expected a boolean value but did not recognise: '" + source + "'" );

    7272           0 :         ArgType temp{};

    7274           0 :         return !result
    7275             :            ? result
    7276           0 :            : LambdaInvoker<typename UnaryLambdaTraits<L>::ReturnType>::invoke( lambda, temp );
    7277             :     }
    7278             : 
    7279             :     template<typename L>
    7280          10 :     struct BoundLambda : BoundValueRefBase {
    7281             :         L m_lambda;
    7282             : 
    7283             :         static_assert( UnaryLambdaTraits<L>::isValid, "Supplied lambda must take exactly one argument" );

    7285             : 
    7286           0 :         auto setValue( std::string const &arg ) -> ParserResult override {

    7290             :

    7292           2 :     struct BoundFlagLambda : BoundFlagRefBase {

    7806           0 :                 return ParserResult::ok( ParseResultType::Matched );
    7807           1 :             };

    7809           0 :                 std::ifstream f( filename.c_str() );

    7989           0 :         return line == other.line && (file == other.file || std::strcmp(file, other.file) == 0);
    7990             :     }

    7992             :         // We can assume that the same file will usually have the same pointer.
    7993             :         // Thus, if the pointers are the same, there is no point in calling the strcmp
    7994           0 :         return line < other.line || ( line == other.line && file != other.file && (std::strcmp(file, other.file) < 0));

    8202             :     // use POSIX/ ANSI console terminal codes
    8203             :     // Thanks to Adam Strzelecki for original contribution
    8204             :     // (http://github.com/nanoant)
    8205             :     // https://github.com/philsquared/Catch/pull/131
    8206           1 :     class PosixColourImpl : public IColourImpl {
    8207             :     public:
    8208           8 :         virtual void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) override {
    8209           8 :             switch( _colourCode ) {
    8210             :                 case Colour::None:
    8211           4 :                 case Colour::White:     return setColour( "[0m" );
    8212           0 :                 case Colour::Red:       return setColour( "[0;31m" );
    8213           0 :                 case Colour::Green:     return setColour( "[0;32m" );
    8214           0 :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setColour( "[0;34m" );
    8215           0 :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setColour( "[0;36m" );
    8216           0 :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setColour( "[0;33m" );
    8217           0 :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setColour( "[1;30m" );
    8218             : 
    8219           0 :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setColour( "[0;37m" );
    8220           1 :                 case Colour::BrightRed:     return setColour( "[1;31m" );
    8221           2 :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setColour( "[1;32m" );
    8222           0 :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setColour( "[1;37m" );
    8223           1 :                 case Colour::BrightYellow:  return setColour( "[1;33m" );
    8224             : 
    8225           0 :                 case Colour::Bright: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "not a colour" );
    8226           0 :                 default: CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown colour requested" );
    8227             :             }
    8228             :         }
    8229           1 :         static IColourImpl* instance() {
    8230           1 :             static PosixColourImpl s_instance;
    8231           1 :             return &s_instance;
    8232             :         }
    8233             : 
    8234             :     private:
    8235           8 :         void setColour( const char* _escapeCode ) {
    8236           8 :             getCurrentContext().getConfig()->stream()
    8237           8 :                 << '\033' << _escapeCode;
    8238           8 :         }
    8239             :     };
    8240             : 
    8241           1 :     bool useColourOnPlatform() {
    8242             :         return
    8243             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8244             :             !isDebuggerActive() &&

    8246             : #if !(defined(__DJGPP__) && defined(__STRICT_ANSI__))
    8247           1 :             isatty(STDOUT_FILENO)
    8248             : #else
    8249             :             false
    8250             : #endif
    8251             :             ;
    8252             :     }
    8253           1 :     IColourImpl* platformColourInstance() {
    8254           2 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
    8255           2 :         IConfigPtr config = getCurrentContext().getConfig();
    8256             :         UseColour::YesOrNo colourMode = config
    8257           1 :             ? config->useColour()
    8258           2 :             : UseColour::Auto;
    8259           1 :         if( colourMode == UseColour::Auto )
    8260           1 :             colourMode = useColourOnPlatform()
    8261             :                 ? UseColour::Yes
    8262           1 :                 : UseColour::No;
    8263             :         return colourMode == UseColour::Yes
    8264             :             ? PosixColourImpl::instance()
    8265           2 :             : NoColourImpl::instance();
    8266             :     }
    8267             : 
    8268             : } // end anon namespace
    8269             : } // end namespace Catch
    8270             : 
    8271             : #else  // not Windows or ANSI ///////////////////////////////////////////////
    8272             : 
    8273             : namespace Catch {
    8274             :

    8397             : // start catch_debugger.cpp
    8398             : 
    8399             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8400             : 
    8401             : #  include <assert.h>
    8402             : #  include <stdbool.h>
    8403             : #  include <sys/types.h>
    8404             : #  include <unistd.h>
    8405             : #  include <sys/sysctl.h>
    8406             : #  include <cstddef>
    8407             : #  include <ostream>
    8408             : 
    8409             : namespace Catch {
    8410             : 
    8411             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    8412             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    8413             : 
    8414             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    8415             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    8416             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8417             : 
    8418             :             int                 mib[4];
    8419             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    8420             :             std::size_t         size;
    8421             : 
    8422             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    8423             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    8424             : 
    8425             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    8426             : 
    8427             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    8428             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    8429             : 
    8430             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    8431             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    8432             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    8433             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    8434             : 
    8435             :             // Call sysctl.
    8436             : 
    8437             :             size = sizeof(info);
    8438             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, nullptr, 0) != 0 ) {
    8439             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    8440             :                 return false;
    8441             :             }
    8442             : 
    8443             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    8444             : 
    8445             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    8446             :         }
    8447             :     } // namespace Catch
    8448             : 
    8449             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    8450             :     #include <fstream>
    8451             :     #include <string>
    8452             : 
    8453             :     namespace Catch{
    8454             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    8455             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    8456             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    8457             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    8458             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    8459             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    8460             :         // there instead.
    8461           0 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8462             :             // Libstdc++ has a bug, where std::ifstream sets errno to 0
    8463             :             // This way our users can properly assert over errno values
    8464           0 :             ErrnoGuard guard;
    8465           0 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    8466           0 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    8467             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    8468           0 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    8469             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    8470             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    8471             :                     // character.
    8472           0 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    8473             :                 }
    8474             :             }
    8475             : 
    8476           0 :             return false;
    8477             :         }
    8478             :     } // namespace Catch
    8479             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    8480             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8481             :     namespace Catch {
    8482             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8483             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8484             :         }
    8485             :     }
    8486             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    8487             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8488             :     namespace Catch {
    8489             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8490             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8491             :         }
    8492             :     }
    8493             : #else
    8494             :     namespace Catch {
    8495             :        bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    8496             :     }
    8497             : #endif // Platform
    8498             : // end catch_debugger.cpp
    8499             : // start catch_decomposer.cpp
    8500             : 
    8501             : namespace Catch {
    8502             : 
    8503             :     ITransientExpression::~ITransientExpression() = default;
    8504             : 
    8505           0 :     void formatReconstructedExpression( std::ostream &os, std::string const& lhs, StringRef op, std::string const& rhs ) {
    8506           0 :         if( lhs.size() + rhs.size() < 40 &&
    8507           0 :                 lhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos &&
    8508           0 :                 rhs.find('\n') == std::string::npos )
    8509           0 :             os << lhs << " " << op << " " << rhs;
    8510             :         else
    8511           0 :             os << lhs << "\n" << op << "\n" << rhs;
    8512           0 :     }
    8513             : }
    8514             : // end catch_decomposer.cpp

    8521             :         Catch::cerr() << "Catch will terminate because it needed to throw an exception.\n"
    8522             :                       << "The message was: " << e.what() << '\n';
    8523             :         std::terminate();

    8548             :     public:

    8564             : namespace Catch {
    8565             : 
    8566           1 :     ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::~ExceptionTranslatorRegistry() {
    8567           1 :     }
    8568             : 
    8569           0 :     void ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::registerTranslator( const IExceptionTranslator* translator ) {
    8570           0 :         m_translators.push_back( std::unique_ptr<const IExceptionTranslator>( translator ) );
    8571           0 :     }
    8572             : 
    8573             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
    8574           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
    8575             :         try {
    8576             : #ifdef __OBJC__
    8577             :             // In Objective-C try objective-c exceptions first
    8578             :             @try {
    8579             :                 return tryTranslators();
    8580             :             }
    8581             :             @catch (NSException *exception) {
    8582             :                 return Catch::Detail::stringify( [exception description] );
    8583             :             }
    8584             : #else
    8585             :             // Compiling a mixed mode project with MSVC means that CLR
    8586             :             // exceptions will be caught in (...) as well. However, these
    8587             :             // do not fill-in std::current_exception and thus lead to crash
    8588             :             // when attempting rethrow.
    8589             :             // /EHa switch also causes structured exceptions to be caught
    8590             :             // here, but they fill-in current_exception properly, so
    8591             :             // at worst the output should be a little weird, instead of
    8592             :             // causing a crash.
    8593           0 :             if (std::current_exception() == nullptr) {
    8594           0 :                 return "Non C++ exception. Possibly a CLR exception.";
    8595             :             }
    8596           0 :             return tryTranslators();
    8597             : #endif
    8598             :         }
    8599           0 :         catch( TestFailureException& ) {
    8600           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    8601             :         }
    8602           0 :         catch( std::exception& ex ) {
    8603           0 :             return ex.what();
    8604             :         }
    8605           0 :         catch( std::string& msg ) {
    8606           0 :             return msg;
    8607             :         }
    8608           0 :         catch( const char* msg ) {
    8609           0 :             return msg;
    8610             :         }
    8611           0 :         catch(...) {
    8612           0 :             return "Unknown exception";
    8613             :         }
    8614             :     }
    8615             : 
    8616           0 :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::tryTranslators() const {
    8617           0 :         if (m_translators.empty()) {
    8618           0 :             std::rethrow_exception(std::current_exception());
    8619             :         } else {
    8620           0 :             return m_translators[0]->translate(m_translators.begin() + 1, m_translators.end());
    8621             :         }
    8622             :     }
    8623             : 
    8624             : #else // ^^ Exceptions are enabled // Exceptions are disabled vv
    8625             :     std::string ExceptionTranslatorRegistry::translateActiveException() const {
    8626             :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Attempted to translate active exception under CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS!");
    8627             :     }
    8628             :

    8637             :

    8641             : #endif
    8642             : 
    8643             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH ) || defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    8644             : 
    8645             : namespace {
    8646             :     // Report the error condition
    8647           0 :     void reportFatal( char const * const message ) {
    8648           0 :         Catch::getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
    8649           0 :     }
    8650             : }
    8651             : 
    8652             : #endif // signals/SEH handling
    8653             : 
    8654             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH )
    8655             : 
    8656             : namespace Catch {
    8657             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    8658             : 
    8659             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    8660             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    8661             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    8662             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    8663             :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    8664             :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    8665             :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    8666             :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    8667             :     };
    8668             : 
    8669             :     LONG CALLBACK FatalConditionHandler::handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    8670             :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    8671             :             if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == def.id) {
    8672             :                 reportFatal(def.name);
    8673             :             }
    8674             :         }
    8675             :         // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
    8676             :         // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    8677             :         return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    8678             :     }
    8679             : 
    8680             :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    8681             :         isSet = true;
    8682             :         // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
    8683             :         // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
    8684             :         guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
    8685             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    8686             :         // Register as first handler in current chain
    8687             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
    8688             :         // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
    8689             :         SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    8690             :     }
    8691             : 
    8692             :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
    8693             :         if (isSet) {
    8694             :             RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
    8695             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    8696             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    8697             :             isSet = false;
    8698             :         }
    8699             :     }
    8700             : 
    8701             :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
    8702             :         reset();
    8703             :     }
    8704             : 
    8705             : bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
    8706             : ULONG FatalConditionHandler::guaranteeSize = 0;
    8707             : PVOID FatalConditionHandler::exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
    8708             : 
    8709             : } // namespace Catch
    8710             : 
    8711             : #elif defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
    8712             : 
    8713             : namespace Catch {
    8714             : 
    8715             :     struct SignalDefs {
    8716             :         int id;
    8717             :         const char* name;
    8718             :     };
    8719             : 
    8720             :     // 32kb for the alternate stack seems to be sufficient. However, this value
    8721             :     // is experimentally determined, so that's not guaranteed.
    8722             :     constexpr static std::size_t sigStackSize = 32768 >= MINSIGSTKSZ ? 32768 : MINSIGSTKSZ;
    8723             : 
    8724             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    8725             :         { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
    8726             :         { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    8727             :         { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
    8728             :         { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    8729             :         { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
    8730             :         { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
    8731             :     };
    8732             : 
    8733           0 :     void FatalConditionHandler::handleSignal( int sig ) {
    8734           0 :         char const * name = "<unknown signal>";
    8735           0 :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
    8736           0 :             if (sig == def.id) {
    8737           0 :                 name = def.name;
    8738           0 :                 break;
    8739             :             }
    8740             :         }
    8741           0 :         reset();
    8742           0 :         reportFatal(name);
    8743           0 :         raise( sig );
    8744           0 :     }
    8745             : 
    8746           9 :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
    8747           9 :         isSet = true;
    8748             :         stack_t sigStack;
    8749           9 :         sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
    8750           9 :         sigStack.ss_size = sigStackSize;
    8751           9 :         sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
    8752           9 :         sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
    8753           9 :         struct sigaction sa = { };
    8754             : 
    8755           9 :         sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
    8756           9 :         sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
    8757          63 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    8758          54 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
    8759             :         }
    8760           9 :     }
    8761             : 
    8762           9 :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
    8763           9 :         reset();
    8764           9 :     }
    8765             : 
    8766          18 :     void FatalConditionHandler::reset() {
    8767          18 :         if( isSet ) {
    8768             :             // Set signals back to previous values -- hopefully nobody overwrote them in the meantime
    8769          63 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i ) {
    8770          54 :                 sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
    8771             :             }
    8772             :             // Return the old stack
    8773           9 :             sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
    8774           9 :             isSet = false;
    8775             :         }
    8776          18 :     }
    8777             : 
    8778             :     bool FatalConditionHandler::isSet = false;
    8779             :     struct sigaction FatalConditionHandler::oldSigActions[sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs)] = {};
    8780             :     stack_t FatalConditionHandler::oldSigStack = {};
    8781             :     char FatalConditionHandler::altStackMem[sigStackSize] = {};
    8782             : 
    8783             : } // namespace Catch
    8784             : 
    8785             : #else
    8786             :

    9099           0 :     std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
    9100           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
    9101           0 :         if( config.hasTestFilters() )
    9102           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
    9103             :         else {
    9104           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
    9105             :         }
    9106             : 
    9107           0 :         auto matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
    9108           0 :         for( auto const& testCaseInfo : matchedTestCases ) {
    9109           0 :             Colour::Code colour = testCaseInfo.isHidden()
    9110             :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
    9111           0 :                 : Colour::None;
    9112           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );
    9113             : 
    9114           0 :             Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.name ).initialIndent( 2 ).indent( 4 ) << "\n";
    9115           0 :             if( config.verbosity() >= Verbosity::High ) {
    9116           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( Catch::Detail::stringify( testCaseInfo.lineInfo ) ).indent(4) << std::endl;
    9117           0 :                 std::string description = testCaseInfo.description;
    9118           0 :                 if( description.empty() )
    9119           0 :                     description = "(NO DESCRIPTION)";
    9120           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( description ).indent(4) << std::endl;
    9121             :             }
    9122           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
    9123           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString() ).indent( 6 ) << "\n";
    9124             :         }
    9125             : 
    9126           0 :         if( !config.hasTestFilters() )
    9127           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    9128             :         else
    9129           0 :             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTestCases.size(), "matching test case" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    9130           0 :         return matchedTestCases.size();
    9131             :     }
    9132             : 
    9133           0 :     std::size_t listTestsNamesOnly( Config const& config ) {

    9138           0 :             matchedTests++;
    9139           0 :             if( startsWith( testCaseInfo.name, '#' ) )
    9140           0 :                Catch::cout() << '"' << testCaseInfo.name << '"';
    9141             :             else
    9142           0 :                Catch::cout() << testCaseInfo.name;
    9143           0 :             if ( config.verbosity() >= Verbosity::High )
    9144           0 :                 Catch::cout() << "\t@" << testCaseInfo.lineInfo;
    9145           0 :             Catch::cout() << std::endl;
    9146             :         }

    9148             :     }
    9149             :

    9162           0 :     std::size_t listTags( Config const& config ) {
    9163           0 :         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();

    9165           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";
    9166             :         else {
    9167           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available tags:\n";
    9168             :         }
    9169             : 
    9170           0 :         std::map<std::string, TagInfo> tagCounts;
    9171             : 
    9172           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

    9174           0 :             for( auto const& tagName : testCase.getTestCaseInfo().tags ) {
    9175           0 :                 std::string lcaseTagName = toLower( tagName );
    9176           0 :                 auto countIt = tagCounts.find( lcaseTagName );
    9177           0 :                 if( countIt == tagCounts.end() )
    9178           0 :                     countIt = tagCounts.insert( std::make_pair( lcaseTagName, TagInfo() ) ).first;
    9179           0 :                 countIt->second.add( tagName );
    9180             :             }
    9181             :         }
    9182             : 
    9183           0 :         for( auto const& tagCount : tagCounts ) {
    9184           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;

    9186           0 :             auto str = rss.str();

    9188           0 :                                                     .initialIndent( 0 )
    9189           0 :                                                     .indent( str.size() )
    9190           0 :                                                     .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-10 );
    9191           0 :             Catch::cout() << str << wrapper << '\n';
    9192             :         }
    9193           0 :         Catch::cout() << pluralise( tagCounts.size(), "tag" ) << '\n' << std::endl;
    9194           0 :         return tagCounts.size();
    9195             :     }
    9196             : 
    9197           0 :     std::size_t listReporters() {

    9201           0 :         for( auto const& factoryKvp : factories )
    9202           0 :             maxNameLen = (std::max)( maxNameLen, factoryKvp.first.size() );
    9203             : 
    9204           0 :         for( auto const& factoryKvp : factories ) {
    9205           0 :             Catch::cout()
    9206           0 :                     << Column( factoryKvp.first + ":" )
    9207           0 :                             .indent(2)
    9208           0 :                             .width( 5+maxNameLen )
    9209           0 :                     +  Column( factoryKvp.second->getDescription() )
    9210           0 :                             .initialIndent(0)
    9211           0 :                             .indent(2)
    9212           0 :                             .width( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - maxNameLen-8 )
    9213           0 :                     << "\n";
    9214             :         }
    9215           0 :         Catch::cout() << std::endl;
    9216           0 :         return factories.size();
    9217             :     }
    9218             : 
    9219           1 :     Option<std::size_t> list( std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config ) {
    9220           1 :         Option<std::size_t> listedCount;
    9221           1 :         getCurrentMutableContext().setConfig( config );

    9223           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTests( *config );
    9224           1 :         if( config->listTestNamesOnly() )
    9225           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTestsNamesOnly( *config );
    9226           1 :         if( config->listTags() )
    9227           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTags( *config );
    9228           1 :         if( config->listReporters() )
    9229           0 :             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listReporters();
    9230           1 :         return listedCount;
    9231             :     }

    9299             : 
    9300             : namespace {
    9301             : 
    9302             : template <typename T>
    9303             : struct Converter;
    9304             : 
    9305             : template <>
    9306             : struct Converter<float> {
    9307             :     static_assert(sizeof(float) == sizeof(int32_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
    9308           0 :     Converter(float f) {
    9309           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &f, sizeof(f));
    9310           0 :     }
    9311             :     int32_t i;
    9312             : };
    9313             : 
    9314             : template <>
    9315             : struct Converter<double> {
    9316             :     static_assert(sizeof(double) == sizeof(int64_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
    9317           0 :     Converter(double d) {
    9318           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &d, sizeof(d));
    9319           0 :     }
    9320             :     int64_t i;
    9321             : };
    9322             : 
    9323             : template <typename T>
    9324           0 : auto convert(T t) -> Converter<T> {
    9325           0 :     return Converter<T>(t);
    9326             : }
    9327             : 
    9328             : template <typename FP>
    9329           0 : bool almostEqualUlps(FP lhs, FP rhs, int maxUlpDiff) {
    9330             :     // Comparison with NaN should always be false.
    9331             :     // This way we can rule it out before getting into the ugly details
    9332           0 :     if (Catch::isnan(lhs) || Catch::isnan(rhs)) {
    9333           0 :         return false;
    9334             :     }
    9335             : 
    9336           0 :     auto lc = convert(lhs);
    9337           0 :     auto rc = convert(rhs);
    9338             : 
    9339           0 :     if ((lc.i < 0) != (rc.i < 0)) {
    9340             :         // Potentially we can have +0 and -0
    9341           0 :         return lhs == rhs;
    9342             :     }
    9343             : 
    9344           0 :     auto ulpDiff = std::abs(lc.i - rc.i);
    9345           0 :     return ulpDiff <= maxUlpDiff;
    9346             : }
    9347             : 
    9348             : }
    9349             : 
    9350             : namespace Catch {
    9351             : namespace Matchers {
    9352             : namespace Floating {
    9353           0 :     WithinAbsMatcher::WithinAbsMatcher(double target, double margin)
    9354           0 :         :m_target{ target }, m_margin{ margin } {
    9355           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(margin >= 0, "Invalid margin: " << margin << '.'
    9356             :             << " Margin has to be non-negative.");
    9357           0 :     }
    9358             : 
    9359             :     // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
    9360             :     // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
    9361           0 :     bool WithinAbsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
    9362           0 :         return (matchee + m_margin >= m_target) && (m_target + m_margin >= matchee);
    9363             :     }
    9364             : 
    9365           0 :     std::string WithinAbsMatcher::describe() const {

    9591             : 
    9592           0 :     Capturer::Capturer( StringRef macroName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, ResultWas::OfType resultType, StringRef names ) {
    9593           0 :         auto trimmed = [&] (size_t start, size_t end) {
    9594           0 :             while (names[start] == ',' || isspace(names[start])) {
    9595           0 :                 ++start;
    9596             :             }
    9597           0 :             while (names[end] == ',' || isspace(names[end])) {
    9598           0 :                 --end;
    9599             :             }
    9600           0 :             return names.substr(start, end - start + 1);
    9601           0 :         };
    9602             : 
    9603           0 :         size_t start = 0;
    9604           0 :         std::stack<char> openings;
    9605           0 :         for (size_t pos = 0; pos < names.size(); ++pos) {
    9606           0 :             char c = names[pos];
    9607           0 :             switch (c) {
    9608             :             case '[':
    9609             :             case '{':
    9610             :             case '(':
    9611             :             // It is basically impossible to disambiguate between
    9612             :             // comparison and start of template args in this context
    9613             : //            case '<':
    9614           0 :                 openings.push(c);
    9615           0 :                 break;
    9616             :             case ']':
    9617             :             case '}':
    9618             :             case ')':
    9619             : //           case '>':
    9620           0 :                 openings.pop();
    9621           0 :                 break;
    9622             :             case ',':
    9623           0 :                 if (start != pos && openings.size() == 0) {
    9624           0 :                     m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
    9625           0 :                     m_messages.back().message = trimmed(start, pos);
    9626           0 :                     m_messages.back().message += " := ";
    9627           0 :                     start = pos;
    9628             :                 }
    9629             :             }
    9630             :         }
    9631           0 :         assert(openings.size() == 0 && "Mismatched openings");
    9632           0 :         m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
    9633           0 :         m_messages.back().message = trimmed(start, names.size() - 1);
    9634           0 :         m_messages.back().message += " := ";
    9635           0 :     }
    9636           0 :     Capturer::~Capturer() {
    9637           0 :         if ( !uncaught_exceptions() ){
    9638           0 :             assert( m_captured == m_messages.size() );
    9639           0 :             for( size_t i = 0; i < m_captured; ++i  )
    9640           0 :                 m_resultCapture.popScopedMessage( m_messages[i] );
    9641             :         }
    9642           0 :     }
    9643             :

    9647           0 :         m_resultCapture.pushScopedMessage( m_messages[index] );

    9712             : 
    9713             :     // Windows's implementation of std::tmpfile is terrible (it tries
    9714             :     // to create a file inside system folder, thus requiring elevated
    9715             :     // privileges for the binary), so we have to use tmpnam(_s) and
    9716             :     // create the file ourselves there.
    9717             :     class TempFile {
    9718             :     public:
    9719             :         TempFile(TempFile const&) = delete;

    9722             :         TempFile& operator=(TempFile&&) = delete;
    9723             :

    9725             :         ~TempFile();

    9728             :         std::string getContents();

    9733             :         char m_buffer[L_tmpnam] = { 0 };
    9734             :     #endif
    9735             :     };
    9736             :

    9814             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
    9815             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
    9816             :         if (tmpnam_s(m_buffer)) {
    9817             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not get a temp filename");
    9818             :         }
    9819             :         if (fopen_s(&m_file, m_buffer, "w")) {
    9820             :             char buffer[100];
    9821             :             if (strerror_s(buffer, errno)) {
    9822             :                 CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not translate errno to a string");
    9823             :             }
    9824             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Coul dnot open the temp file: '" << m_buffer << "' because: " << buffer);
    9825             :         }
    9826             :     }
    9827             : #else
    9828             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
    9829             :         m_file = std::tmpfile();
    9830             :         if (!m_file) {
    9831             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not create a temp file.");
    9832             :         }
    9833             :     }
    9834             : 
    9835             : #endif
    9836             : 
    9837             :     TempFile::~TempFile() {
    9838             :          // TBD: What to do about errors here?
    9839             :          std::fclose(m_file);
    9840             :          // We manually create the file on Windows only, on Linux
    9841             :          // it will be autodeleted
    9842             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
    9843             :          std::remove(m_buffer);
    9844             : #endif
    9845             :     }
    9846             : 
    9847             :     FILE* TempFile::getFile() {
    9848             :         return m_file;
    9849             :     }
    9850             : 
    9851             :     std::string TempFile::getContents() {
    9852             :         std::stringstream sstr;
    9853             :         char buffer[100] = {};
    9854             :         std::rewind(m_file);
    9855             :         while (std::fgets(buffer, sizeof(buffer), m_file)) {
    9856             :             sstr << buffer;
    9857             :         }
    9858             :         return sstr.str();
    9859             :     }
    9860             : 
    9861             :     OutputRedirect::OutputRedirect(std::string& stdout_dest, std::string& stderr_dest) :
    9862             :         m_originalStdout(dup(1)),
    9863             :         m_originalStderr(dup(2)),
    9864             :         m_stdoutDest(stdout_dest),
    9865             :         m_stderrDest(stderr_dest) {
    9866             :         dup2(fileno(m_stdoutFile.getFile()), 1);
    9867             :         dup2(fileno(m_stderrFile.getFile()), 2);
    9868             :     }
    9869             : 
    9870             :     OutputRedirect::~OutputRedirect() {
    9871             :         Catch::cout() << std::flush;
    9872             :         fflush(stdout);
    9873             :         // Since we support overriding these streams, we flush cerr
    9874             :         // even though std::cerr is unbuffered
    9875             :         Catch::cerr() << std::flush;
    9876             :         Catch::clog() << std::flush;
    9877             :         fflush(stderr);
    9878             : 
    9879             :         dup2(m_originalStdout, 1);
    9880             :         dup2(m_originalStderr, 2);
    9881             : 
    9882             :         m_stdoutDest += m_stdoutFile.getContents();
    9883             :         m_stderrDest += m_stderrFile.getContents();
    9884             :     }
    9885             : 
    9886             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE
    9887             : 
    9888             : } // namespace Catch
