   10246             :         struct GeneratorTracker : TestCaseTracking::TrackerBase, IGeneratorTracker {
   10247             :             GeneratorBasePtr m_generator;
   10248             : 
   10249           0 :             GeneratorTracker( TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent )
   10250           0 :             :   TrackerBase( nameAndLocation, ctx, parent )
   10251           0 :             {}
   10252             :             ~GeneratorTracker();
   10253             : 
   10254           0 :             static GeneratorTracker& acquire( TrackerContext& ctx, TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation ) {
   10255           0 :                 std::shared_ptr<GeneratorTracker> tracker;
   10256             : 
   10257           0 :                 ITracker& currentTracker = ctx.currentTracker();
   10258           0 :                 if( TestCaseTracking::ITrackerPtr childTracker = currentTracker.findChild( nameAndLocation ) ) {
   10259           0 :                     assert( childTracker );
   10260           0 :                     assert( childTracker->isGeneratorTracker() );
   10261           0 :                     tracker = std::static_pointer_cast<GeneratorTracker>( childTracker );
   10262             :                 }
   10263             :                 else {
   10264           0 :                     tracker = std::make_shared<GeneratorTracker>( nameAndLocation, ctx, &currentTracker );
   10265           0 :                     currentTracker.addChild( tracker );
   10266             :                 }
   10267             : 
   10268           0 :                 if( !ctx.completedCycle() && !tracker->isComplete() ) {
   10269           0 :                     tracker->open();
   10270             :                 }
   10271             : 
   10272           0 :                 return *tracker;
   10273             :             }
   10274             : 
   10275             :             // TrackerBase interface
   10276           0 :             bool isGeneratorTracker() const override { return true; }

   10278           0 :                 return !!m_generator;
   10279             :             }

   10317             :

   10321             : 
   10322           1 :     void RunContext::testGroupEnded(std::string const& testSpec, Totals const& totals, std::size_t groupIndex, std::size_t groupsCount) {

   10325             : 
   10326           9 :     Totals RunContext::runTest(TestCase const& testCase) {
   10327           9 :         Totals prevTotals = m_totals;
   10328             : 
   10329          18 :         std::string redirectedCout;
   10330          18 :         std::string redirectedCerr;
   10331             : 
   10332           9 :         auto const& testInfo = testCase.getTestCaseInfo();
   10333             : 
   10334           9 :         m_reporter->testCaseStarting(testInfo);
   10335             : 
   10336           9 :         m_activeTestCase = &testCase;
   10337             : 
   10338           9 :         ITracker& rootTracker = m_trackerContext.startRun();
   10339           9 :         assert(rootTracker.isSectionTracker());
   10340           9 :         static_cast<SectionTracker&>(rootTracker).addInitialFilters(m_config->getSectionsToRun());
   10341           9 :         do {
   10342           9 :             m_trackerContext.startCycle();
   10343           9 :             m_testCaseTracker = &SectionTracker::acquire(m_trackerContext, TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation(testInfo.name, testInfo.lineInfo));
   10344           9 :             runCurrentTest(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
   10345           9 :         } while (!m_testCaseTracker->isSuccessfullyCompleted() && !aborting());
   10346             : 
   10347           9 :         Totals deltaTotals = m_totals.delta(prevTotals);
   10348           9 :         if (testInfo.expectedToFail() && deltaTotals.testCases.passed > 0) {
   10349           0 :             deltaTotals.assertions.failed++;
   10350           0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.passed--;
   10351           0 :             deltaTotals.testCases.failed++;
   10352             :         }
   10353           9 :         m_totals.testCases += deltaTotals.testCases;
   10354          27 :         m_reporter->testCaseEnded(TestCaseStats(testInfo,
   10355             :                                   deltaTotals,
   10356             :                                   redirectedCout,
   10357             :                                   redirectedCerr,
   10358          18 :                                   aborting()));

   10374           0 :     void RunContext::assertionEnded(AssertionResult const & result) {
   10375           0 :         if (result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Ok) {
   10376           0 :             m_totals.assertions.passed++;

   10379           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = false;

   10381           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failedButOk++;
   10382             :             else
   10383           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failed++;
   10384             :         }
   10385             :         else {
   10386           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = true;
   10387             :         }

   10390             :         // and should be let to clear themselves out.

   10394           0 :             m_messageScopes.clear();
   10395             : 
   10396             :         // Reset working state
   10397           0 :         resetAssertionInfo();

   10548           9 :     void RunContext::runCurrentTest(std::string & redirectedCout, std::string & redirectedCerr) {
   10549           9 :         auto const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
   10550          18 :         SectionInfo testCaseSection(testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name);
   10551           9 :         m_reporter->sectionStarting(testCaseSection);

   10553           9 :         double duration = 0;
   10554           9 :         m_shouldReportUnexpected = true;
   10555           9 :         m_lastAssertionInfo = { "TEST_CASE"_sr, testCaseInfo.lineInfo, StringRef(), ResultDisposition::Normal };
   10556             : 
   10557           9 :         seedRng(*m_config);

   10559           9 :         Timer timer;

   10561           9 :             if (m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut) {
   10562             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_EXPERIMENTAL_REDIRECT)
   10563           0 :                 RedirectedStreams redirectedStreams(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
   10564             :

   10568             :                 OutputRedirect r(redirectedCout, redirectedCerr);
   10569             :                 timer.start();
   10570             :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   10571             : #endif
   10572             :             } else {
   10573           9 :                 timer.start();
   10574           9 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   10575             :             }
   10576           9 :             duration = timer.getElapsedSeconds();
   10577           0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ANON (TestFailureException&) {
   10578             :             // This just means the test was aborted due to failure
   10579           0 :         } CATCH_CATCH_ALL {
   10580             :             // Under CATCH_CONFIG_FAST_COMPILE, unexpected exceptions under REQUIRE assertions
   10581             :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.

   10631           0 :                 reportExpr(info, ResultWas::Ok, &expr, negated);

   10635           0 :             reportExpr(info, ResultWas::ExpressionFailed, &expr, negated );

   10868             : 
   10869           1 :         IStreamingReporterPtr makeReporter(std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config) {
   10870           1 :             if (Catch::getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getListeners().empty()) {
   10871           1 :                 return createReporter(config->getReporterName(), config);
   10872             :             }
   10873             : 
   10874             :             // On older platforms, returning std::unique_ptr<ListeningReporter>
   10875             :             // when the return type is std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>
   10876             :             // doesn't compile without a std::move call. However, this causes
   10877             :             // a warning on newer platforms. Thus, we have to work around
   10878             :             // it a bit and downcast the pointer manually.
   10879           0 :             auto ret = std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>(new ListeningReporter);

   11087           1 :             config(); // Force config to be constructed

   11091           1 :             if( m_configData.filenamesAsTags )
   11092           0 :                 applyFilenamesAsTags( *m_config );

   11094             :             // Handle list request

   11096           0 :                 return static_cast<int>( *listed );
   11097             : 
   11098           1 :             auto totals = runTests( m_config );

   11100             :             // the return value to 255 prevents false negative when some multiple
   11101             :             // of 256 tests has failed
   11102           1 :             return (std::min) (MaxExitCode, (std::max) (totals.error, static_cast<int>(totals.assertions.failed)));

   11176             :         template<typename WriterF, std::size_t bufferSize=256>
   11177             :         class StreamBufImpl : public std::streambuf {
   11178             :             char data[bufferSize];
   11179             :             WriterF m_writer;
   11180             : 
   11181             :         public:
   11182           0 :             StreamBufImpl() {
   11183           0 :                 setp( data, data + sizeof(data) );
   11184           0 :             }
   11185             : 
   11186           0 :             ~StreamBufImpl() noexcept {
   11187           0 :                 StreamBufImpl::sync();
   11188           0 :             }
   11189             : 
   11190             :         private:
   11191           0 :             int overflow( int c ) override {
   11192           0 :                 sync();
   11193             : 
   11194           0 :                 if( c != EOF ) {
   11195           0 :                     if( pbase() == epptr() )
   11196           0 :                         m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
   11197             :                     else
   11198           0 :                         sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
   11199             :                 }
   11200           0 :                 return 0;
   11201             :             }
   11202             : 
   11203           0 :             int sync() override {
   11204           0 :                 if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
   11205           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
   11206           0 :                     setp( pbase(), epptr() );
   11207             :                 }
   11208           0 :                 return 0;
   11209             :             }
   11210             :         };

   11348           1 :     bool startsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& prefix ) {
   11349           1 :         return s.size() >= prefix.size() && std::equal(prefix.begin(), prefix.end(), s.begin());
   11350             :     }
   11351           9 :     bool startsWith( std::string const& s, char prefix ) {
   11352           9 :         return !s.empty() && s[0] == prefix;
   11353             :     }
   11354           0 :     bool endsWith( std::string const& s, std::string const& suffix ) {
   11355           0 :         return s.size() >= suffix.size() && std::equal(suffix.rbegin(), suffix.rend(), s.rbegin());
   11356             :     }
   11357           0 :     bool endsWith( std::string const& s, char suffix ) {
   11358           0 :         return !s.empty() && s[s.size()-1] == suffix;
   11359             :     }
   11360           0 :     bool contains( std::string const& s, std::string const& infix ) {
   11361           0 :         return s.find( infix ) != std::string::npos;
   11362             :     }
   11363           1 :     void toLowerInPlace( std::string& s ) {
   11364           1 :         std::transform( s.begin(), s.end(), s.begin(), toLowerCh );
   11365           1 :     }
   11366           1 :     std::string toLower( std::string const& s ) {
   11367           1 :         std::string lc = s;
   11368           1 :         toLowerInPlace( lc );
   11369           1 :         return lc;
   11370             :     }
   11371           0 :     std::string trim( std::string const& str ) {
   11372             :         static char const* whitespaceChars = "\n\r\t ";
   11373           0 :         std::string::size_type start = str.find_first_not_of( whitespaceChars );
   11374           0 :         std::string::size_type end = str.find_last_not_of( whitespaceChars );
   11375             : 
   11376           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();
   11377             :     }
   11378             : 
   11379           0 :     bool replaceInPlace( std::string& str, std::string const& replaceThis, std::string const& withThis ) {
   11380           0 :         bool replaced = false;
   11381           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );
   11382           0 :         while( i != std::string::npos ) {
   11383           0 :             replaced = true;
   11384           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );
   11385           0 :             if( i < str.size()-withThis.size() )
   11386           0 :                 i = str.find( replaceThis, i+withThis.size() );
   11387             :             else
   11388           0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
   11389             :         }
   11390           0 :         return replaced;
   11391             :     }

   11605           0 :         TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
   11606           0 :             if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
   11607           0 :                 tag == "!hide" )
   11608           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
   11609           0 :             else if( tag == "!throws" )
   11610           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
   11611           0 :             else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
   11612           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
   11613           0 :             else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
   11614           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
   11615           0 :             else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
   11616           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
   11617           0 :             else if( tag == "!benchmark" )
   11618           0 :                 return static_cast<TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties>( TestCaseInfo::Benchmark | TestCaseInfo::IsHidden );
   11619             :             else
   11620           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::None;
   11621             :         }
   11622           0 :         bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
   11623           0 :             return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( static_cast<unsigned char>(tag[0]) );
   11624             :         }

   11768           1 :     std::vector<TestCase> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCase> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
   11769             : 
   11770           1 :         std::vector<TestCase> sorted = unsortedTestCases;
   11771             : 
   11772           1 :         switch( config.runOrder() ) {
   11773             :             case RunTests::InLexicographicalOrder:
   11774           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end() );
   11775           0 :                 break;
   11776             :             case RunTests::InRandomOrder:
   11777           0 :                 seedRng( config );
   11778           0 :                 std::shuffle( sorted.begin(), sorted.end(), rng() );
   11779           0 :                 break;
   11780             :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
   11781             :                 // already in declaration order
   11782           1 :                 break;
   11783             :         }
   11784           1 :         return sorted;
   11785             :     }
   11786           9 :     bool matchTest( TestCase const& testCase, TestSpec const& testSpec, IConfig const& config ) {
   11787           9 :         return testSpec.matches( testCase ) && ( config.allowThrows() || !testCase.throws() );
   11788             :     }
   11789             : 
   11790           1 :     void enforceNoDuplicateTestCases( std::vector<TestCase> const& functions ) {
   11791           2 :         std::set<TestCase> seenFunctions;
   11792          10 :         for( auto const& function : functions ) {
   11793           9 :             auto prev = seenFunctions.insert( function );
   11794           9 :             CATCH_ENFORCE( prev.second,
   11795             :                     "error: TEST_CASE( \"" << function.name << "\" ) already defined.\n"
   11796             :                     << "\tFirst seen at " << prev.first->getTestCaseInfo().lineInfo << "\n"
   11797             :                     << "\tRedefined at " << function.getTestCaseInfo().lineInfo );
   11798             :         }
   11799           1 :     }
   11800             : 
   11801           0 :     std::vector<TestCase> filterTests( std::vector<TestCase> const& testCases, TestSpec const& testSpec, IConfig const& config ) {
   11802           0 :         std::vector<TestCase> filtered;
   11803           0 :         filtered.reserve( testCases.size() );
   11804           0 :         for( auto const& testCase : testCases )
   11805           0 :             if( matchTest( testCase, testSpec, config ) )
   11806           0 :                 filtered.push_back( testCase );
   11807           0 :         return filtered;
   11808             :     }

   11844           9 :     std::string extractClassName( StringRef const& classOrQualifiedMethodName ) {
   11845           9 :         std::string className = classOrQualifiedMethodName;
   11846           9 :         if( startsWith( className, '&' ) )
   11847             :         {
   11848           0 :             std::size_t lastColons = className.rfind( "::" );
   11849           0 :             std::size_t penultimateColons = className.rfind( "::", lastColons-1 );

   11851           0 :                 penultimateColons = 1;
   11852           0 :             className = className.substr( penultimateColons, lastColons-penultimateColons );
   11853             :         }
   11854           9 :         return className;
   11855             :     }

   12201           3 :     void TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {
   12202           3 :         if( m_mode == None ) {
   12203           2 :             switch( c ) {
   12204           0 :             case ' ': return;
   12205           1 :             case '~': m_exclusion = true; return;

   12207           0 :             case '"': return startNewMode( QuotedName, ++m_pos );

   12210             :             }
   12211             :         }
   12212           1 :         if( m_mode == Name ) {

   12219           0 :                     m_exclusion = true;

   12223             :             }

   12263             : static const uint64_t nanosecondsInSecond = 1000000000;

   12265             : namespace Catch {

   12267          18 :     auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
   12268          18 :         return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch() ).count();
   12269             :     }
   12270             : 
   12271             :     namespace {
   12272           0 :         auto estimateClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   12273           0 :             uint64_t sum = 0;
   12274             :             static const uint64_t iterations = 1000000;
   12275             : 
   12276           0 :             auto startTime = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   12277             : 
   12278           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < iterations; ++i ) {
   12279             : 
   12280             :                 uint64_t ticks;
   12281           0 :                 uint64_t baseTicks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   12282           0 :                 do {
   12283           0 :                     ticks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   12284           0 :                 } while( ticks == baseTicks );
   12285             : 
   12286           0 :                 auto delta = ticks - baseTicks;
   12287           0 :                 sum += delta;
   12288             : 
   12289             :                 // If we have been calibrating for over 3 seconds -- the clock
   12290             :                 // is terrible and we should move on.
   12291             :                 // TBD: How to signal that the measured resolution is probably wrong?
   12292           0 :                 if (ticks > startTime + 3 * nanosecondsInSecond) {
   12293           0 :                     return sum / ( i + 1u );
   12294             :                 }
   12295             :             }
   12296             : 
   12297             :             // We're just taking the mean, here. To do better we could take the std. dev and exclude outliers
   12298             :             // - and potentially do more iterations if there's a high variance.
   12299           0 :             return sum/iterations;
   12300             :         }
   12301             :     }
   12302           0 :     auto getEstimatedClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   12303           0 :         static auto s_resolution = estimateClockResolution();
   12304           0 :         return s_resolution;
   12305             :     }
   12306             : 
   12307           9 :     void Timer::start() {
   12308           9 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   12309           9 :     }
   12310           9 :     auto Timer::getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   12311           9 :         return getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() - m_nanoseconds;
   12312             :     }
   12313           9 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   12314           9 :         return getElapsedNanoseconds()/1000;
   12315             :     }
   12316           0 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int {
   12317           0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
   12318             :     }
   12319           9 :     auto Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const -> double {
   12320           9 :         return getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000000.0;
   12321             :     }

   12347             :     namespace {
   12348             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
   12349             : 
   12350             :         struct Endianness {
   12351             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
   12352             : 
   12353           0 :             static Arch which() {
   12354             :                 union _{
   12355             :                     int asInt;
   12356             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
   12357             :                 } u;
   12358             : 
   12359           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
   12360           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
   12361             :             }
   12362             :         };
   12363             :     }
   12364             : 
   12365           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
   12366             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
   12367           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
   12368           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
   12369           0 :             i = end-1;
   12370           0 :             end = inc = -1;
   12371             :         }
   12372             : 
   12373           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
   12374           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   12375           0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
   12376           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
   12377           0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
   12378           0 :        return rss.str();
   12379             :     }
   12380             : }
   12381             : 
   12382             : template<typename T>
   12383           0 : std::string fpToString( T value, int precision ) {
   12384           0 :     if (Catch::isnan(value)) {
   12385           0 :         return "nan";
   12386             :     }
   12387             : 
   12388           0 :     ReusableStringStream rss;
   12389           0 :     rss << std::setprecision( precision )
   12390           0 :         << std::fixed
   12391             :         << value;
   12392           0 :     std::string d = rss.str();
   12393           0 :     std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of( '0' );
   12394           0 :     if( i != std::string::npos && i != d.size()-1 ) {
   12395           0 :         if( d[i] == '.' )
   12396           0 :             i++;
   12397           0 :         d = d.substr( 0, i+1 );
   12398             :     }
   12399           0 :     return d;
   12400             : }

   12403             : //

   12685           0 :         if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   12686           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
   12687           0 :             m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;

   12690           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );

   12692             :         }
   12693           0 :     }

   12695           0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
   12696           0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
   12697             :             case NoWildcard:
   12698           0 :                 return m_pattern == adjustCase( str );
   12699             :             case WildcardAtStart:
   12700           0 :                 return endsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   12701             :             case WildcardAtEnd:
   12702           0 :                 return startsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   12703             :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
   12704           0 :                 return contains( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   12705             :             default:
   12706           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
   12707             :         }
   12708             :     }
   12709             : 
   12710           0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::adjustCase( std::string const& str ) const {
   12711           0 :         return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str;
   12712             :     }

   12717             : #include <iomanip>
   12718             : 
   12719             : using uchar = unsigned char;
   12720             : 
   12721             : namespace Catch {
   12722             : 
   12723             : namespace {
   12724             : 
   12725           0 :     size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
   12726           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   12727           0 :             return 2;
   12728             :         }
   12729           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   12730           0 :             return 3;
   12731             :         }
   12732           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   12733           0 :             return 4;
   12734             :         }
   12735           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   12736             :     }
   12737             : 
   12738           0 :     uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
   12739           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   12740           0 :             return c & 0x1F;
   12741             :         }
   12742           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   12743           0 :             return c & 0x0F;
   12744             :         }
   12745           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   12746           0 :             return c & 0x07;
   12747             :         }
   12748           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   12749             :     }
   12750             : 
   12751           0 :     void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
   12752           0 :         std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
   12753           0 :         os << "\\x"
   12754           0 :             << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
   12755           0 :             << static_cast<int>(c);
   12756           0 :         os.flags(f);
   12757           0 :     }
   12758             : 
   12759             : } // anonymous namespace
   12760             : 
   12761           0 :     XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
   12762             :     :   m_str( str ),
   12763           0 :         m_forWhat( forWhat )
   12764           0 :     {}
   12765             : 
   12766           0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
   12767             :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
   12768             :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
   12769             : 
   12770           0 :         for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
   12771           0 :             uchar c = m_str[idx];
   12772           0 :             switch (c) {
   12773           0 :             case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
   12774           0 :             case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
   12775             : 
   12776             :             case '>':
   12777             :                 // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
   12778           0 :                 if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
   12779           0 :                     os << "&gt;";
   12780             :                 else
   12781           0 :                     os << c;
   12782           0 :                 break;
   12783             : 
   12784             :             case '\"':
   12785           0 :                 if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
   12786           0 :                     os << "&quot;";
   12787             :                 else
   12788           0 :                     os << c;
   12789           0 :                 break;
   12790             : 
   12791             :             default:
   12792             :                 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
   12793             : 
   12794             :                 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
   12795             :                 // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
   12796           0 :                 if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
   12797           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   12798           0 :                     break;
   12799             :                 }
   12800             : 
   12801             :                 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
   12802           0 :                 if (c < 0x7F) {
   12803           0 :                     os << c;
   12804           0 :                     break;
   12805             :                 }
   12806             : 
   12807             :                 // UTF-8 territory
   12808             :                 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
   12809             :                 // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
   12810             :                 // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
   12811             :                 // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
   12812             :                 // Or as 10XX XXXX
   12813           0 :                 if (c <  0xC0 ||
   12814             :                     c >= 0xF8) {
   12815           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   12816           0 :                     break;
   12817             :                 }
   12818             : 
   12819           0 :                 auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
   12820             :                 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
   12821           0 :                 if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
   12822           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   12823           0 :                     break;
   12824             :                 }
   12825             :                 // The header is valid, check data
   12826             :                 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
   12827             :                 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
   12828           0 :                 bool valid = true;
   12829           0 :                 uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
   12830           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   12831           0 :                     uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
   12832           0 :                     valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
   12833           0 :                     value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
   12834             :                 }
   12835             : 
   12836           0 :                 if (
   12837             :                     // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
   12838           0 :                     (!valid) ||
   12839             :                     // Overlong encodings
   12840           0 :                     (value < 0x80) ||
   12841           0 :                     (0x80 <= value && value < 0x800   && encBytes > 2) ||
   12842           0 :                     (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
   12843             :                     // Encoded value out of range
   12844             :                     (value >= 0x110000)
   12845             :                     ) {
   12846           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   12847           0 :                     break;
   12848             :                 }
   12849             : 
   12850             :                 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
   12851           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   12852           0 :                     os << m_str[idx + n];
   12853             :                 }
   12854           0 :                 idx += encBytes - 1;
   12855           0 :                 break;
   12856             :             }
   12857             :         }
   12858           0 :     }
   12859             : 
   12860           0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
   12861           0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
   12862           0 :         return os;
   12863             :     }
   12864             :

   12897           0 :     XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
   12898           0 :         while( !m_tags.empty() )
   12899           0 :             endElement();
   12900           0 :     }
   12901             : 
   12902           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name ) {
   12903           0 :         ensureTagClosed();
   12904           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   12905           0 :         m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
   12906           0 :         m_tags.push_back( name );
   12907           0 :         m_indent += "  ";
   12908           0 :         m_tagIsOpen = true;
   12909           0 :         return *this;
   12910             :     }
   12911             : 
   12912           0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
   12913           0 :         ScopedElement scoped( this );
   12914           0 :         startElement( name );
   12915           0 :         return scoped;
   12916             :     }
   12917             : 
   12918           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
   12919           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   12920           0 :         m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
   12921           0 :         if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   12922           0 :             m_os << "/>";
   12923           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   12924             :         }
   12925             :         else {
   12926           0 :             m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
   12927             :         }
   12928           0 :         m_os << std::endl;
   12929           0 :         m_tags.pop_back();
   12930           0 :         return *this;
   12931             :     }
   12932             :

   12941           0 :         return *this;

   12952             :         }

   12954             :     }

   13005             :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   13006             :     // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   13007           0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   13008             :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   13009             :         // + 1 for decimal point
   13010             :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   13011             :         // + 1 for null terminator
   13012           0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   13013             :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   13014             : 
   13015             :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   13016           0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   13017             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   13018             :         sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   13019             : #else
   13020           0 :         std::sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   13021             : #endif
   13022           0 :         return std::string(buffer);
   13023             :     }

   13052             :     // Colour::LightGrey
   13053           0 :     Catch::Colour::Code dimColour() { return Catch::Colour::FileName; }
   13054             : 
   13055           0 :     std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) {
   13056             :         return count == 1 ? std::string() :
   13057           0 :                count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   13058             :     }
   13059             :

   13061             : 
   13062             : namespace Catch {
   13063             : namespace {
   13064             : // Colour, message variants:
   13065             : // - white: No tests ran.
   13066             : // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   13067             : // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   13068             : // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   13069             : // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   13070           0 : void printTotals(std::ostream& out, const Totals& totals) {
   13071           0 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   13072           0 :         out << "No tests ran.";
   13073           0 :     } else if (totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total()) {
   13074           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   13075             :         const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   13076           0 :             totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   13077           0 :             bothOrAll(totals.assertions.failed) : std::string();
   13078             :         out <<
   13079           0 :             "Failed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.failed)
   13080           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   13081           0 :             "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   13082           0 :             pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   13083           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() == 0) {
   13084             :         out <<
   13085           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.total())
   13086           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.total(), "test case")
   13087           0 :             << " (no assertions).";
   13088           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.failed) {
   13089           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   13090             :         out <<
   13091           0 :             "Failed " << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   13092           0 :             "failed " << pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   13093             :     } else {
   13094           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultSuccess);
   13095             :         out <<
   13096           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.passed)
   13097           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") <<
   13098           0 :             " with " << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << '.';
   13099             :     }
   13100           0 : }
   13101             : 
   13102             : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
   13103           0 : class AssertionPrinter {
   13104             : public:
   13105             :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   13106             :     AssertionPrinter(AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   13107           0 :     AssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   13108             :         : stream(_stream)
   13109             :         , result(_stats.assertionResult)
   13110             :         , messages(_stats.infoMessages)
   13111           0 :         , itMessage(_stats.infoMessages.begin())
   13112           0 :         , printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {}
   13113             : 
   13114           0 :     void print() {
   13115           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   13116             : 
   13117           0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
   13118             : 
   13119           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   13120             :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   13121           0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString());
   13122           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   13123           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   13124           0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
   13125           0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   13126             :             else
   13127           0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
   13128           0 :             break;
   13129             :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   13130           0 :             if (result.isOk())
   13131           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string(" - but was ok"));
   13132             :             else
   13133           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   13134           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   13135           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   13136           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13137           0 :             break;
   13138             :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   13139           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   13140           0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
   13141           0 :             printMessage();
   13142           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   13143           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13144           0 :             break;
   13145             :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   13146           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   13147           0 :             printIssue("fatal error condition with message:");
   13148           0 :             printMessage();
   13149           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   13150           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13151           0 :             break;
   13152             :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   13153           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   13154           0 :             printIssue("expected exception, got none");
   13155           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   13156           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13157           0 :             break;
   13158             :         case ResultWas::Info:
   13159           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info");
   13160           0 :             printMessage();
   13161           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13162           0 :             break;
   13163             :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   13164           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "warning");
   13165           0 :             printMessage();
   13166           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   13167           0 :             break;
   13168             :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   13169           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   13170           0 :             printIssue("explicitly");
   13171           0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   13172           0 :             break;
   13173             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   13174             :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   13175             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   13176             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   13177           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");
   13178           0 :             break;
   13179             :         }
   13180           0 :     }

   13183           0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {

   13186           0 :     }
   13187             :

   13189           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   13190             :             {
   13191           0 :                 Colour colourGuard(colour);
   13192           0 :                 stream << ' ' << passOrFail;
   13193             :             }
   13194           0 :             stream << ':';

   13200           0 :     }

   13202           0 :     void printExpressionWas() {
   13203           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   13204           0 :             stream << ';';

   13206           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   13207           0 :                 stream << " expression was:";
   13208             :             }
   13209           0 :             printOriginalExpression();

   13211           0 :     }
   13212             : 
   13213           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   13214           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   13215           0 :             stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();
   13216             :         }
   13217           0 :     }

   13219           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   13220           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   13221             :             {
   13222           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   13223           0 :                 stream << " for: ";
   13224             :             }
   13225           0 :             stream << result.getExpandedExpression();
   13226             :         }
   13227           0 :     }
   13228             : 
   13229           0 :     void printMessage() {
   13230           0 :         if (itMessage != messages.end()) {
   13231           0 :             stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   13232           0 :             ++itMessage;
   13233             :         }
   13234           0 :     }
   13235             : 
   13236           0 :     void printRemainingMessages(Colour::Code colour = dimColour()) {
   13237           0 :         if (itMessage == messages.end())
   13238           0 :             return;
   13239             : 
   13240             :         // using messages.end() directly yields (or auto) compilation error:
   13241           0 :         std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator itEnd = messages.end();
   13242           0 :         const std::size_t N = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(itMessage, itEnd));
   13243             : 
   13244             :         {
   13245           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   13246           0 :             stream << " with " << pluralise(N, "message") << ':';
   13247             :         }
   13248             : 
   13249           0 :         for (; itMessage != itEnd; ) {
   13250             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   13251           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info) {
   13252           0 :                 stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   13253           0 :                 if (++itMessage != itEnd) {
   13254           0 :                     Colour colourGuard(dimColour());
   13255           0 :                     stream << " and";
   13256             :                 }
   13257             :             }
   13258             :         }
   13259             :     }
   13260             :

   13338             : // Formatter impl for ConsoleReporter
   13339           0 : class ConsoleAssertionPrinter {
   13340             : public:
   13341             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter& operator= (ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   13342             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   13343           0 :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   13344             :         : stream(_stream),
   13345             :         stats(_stats),
   13346             :         result(_stats.assertionResult),
   13347             :         colour(Colour::None),
   13348           0 :         message(result.getMessage()),
   13349             :         messages(_stats.infoMessages),
   13350           0 :         printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {
   13351           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   13352             :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   13353           0 :             colour = Colour::Success;
   13354           0 :             passOrFail = "PASSED";
   13355             :             //if( result.hasMessage() )
   13356           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   13357           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   13358           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   13359           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   13360           0 :             break;
   13361             :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   13362           0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
   13363           0 :                 colour = Colour::Success;
   13364           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
   13365             :             } else {
   13366           0 :                 colour = Colour::Error;
   13367           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED";
   13368             :             }
   13369           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   13370           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   13371           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   13372           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   13373           0 :             break;
   13374             :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   13375           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   13376           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   13377           0 :             messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with ";
   13378           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   13379           0 :                 messageLabel += "message";
   13380           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   13381           0 :                 messageLabel += "messages";
   13382           0 :             break;
   13383             :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   13384           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   13385           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   13386           0 :             messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
   13387           0 :             break;
   13388             :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   13389           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   13390           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   13391           0 :             messageLabel = "because no exception was thrown where one was expected";
   13392           0 :             break;
   13393             :         case ResultWas::Info:
   13394           0 :             messageLabel = "info";
   13395           0 :             break;
   13396             :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   13397           0 :             messageLabel = "warning";
   13398           0 :             break;
   13399             :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   13400           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   13401           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   13402           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   13403           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with message";
   13404           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   13405           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with messages";
   13406           0 :             break;
   13407             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   13408             :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   13409             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   13410             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   13411           0 :             passOrFail = "** internal error **";
   13412           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   13413           0 :             break;
   13414             :         }
   13415           0 :     }
   13416             : 
   13417           0 :     void print() const {
   13418           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   13419           0 :         if (stats.totals.assertions.total() > 0) {
   13420           0 :             printResultType();
   13421           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   13422           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   13423             :         } else {
   13424           0 :             stream << '\n';
   13425             :         }
   13426           0 :         printMessage();
   13427           0 :     }
   13428             : 
   13429             : private:
   13430           0 :     void printResultType() const {
   13431           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   13432           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   13433           0 :             stream << passOrFail << ":\n";
   13434             :         }
   13435           0 :     }
   13436           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   13437           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   13438           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::OriginalExpression);
   13439           0 :             stream << "  ";
   13440           0 :             stream << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   13441           0 :             stream << '\n';
   13442             :         }
   13443           0 :     }
   13444           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   13445           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   13446           0 :             stream << "with expansion:\n";
   13447           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::ReconstructedExpression);
   13448           0 :             stream << Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';
   13449             :         }
   13450           0 :     }
   13451           0 :     void printMessage() const {
   13452           0 :         if (!messageLabel.empty())
   13453           0 :             stream << messageLabel << ':' << '\n';

   13499             : class Duration {
   13500             :     enum class Unit {
   13501             :         Auto,
   13502             :         Nanoseconds,
   13503             :         Microseconds,
   13504             :         Milliseconds,
   13505             :         Seconds,
   13506             :         Minutes
   13507             :     };
   13508             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
   13509             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
   13510             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
   13511             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
   13512             : 
   13513             :     uint64_t m_inNanoseconds;
   13514             :     Unit m_units;
   13515             : 
   13516             : public:
   13517           0 :     explicit Duration(uint64_t inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   13518             :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
   13519           0 :         m_units(units) {
   13520           0 :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
   13521           0 :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
   13522           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
   13523           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
   13524           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
   13525           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
   13526           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
   13527           0 :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
   13528           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
   13529             :             else
   13530           0 :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
   13531             :         }
   13532             : 
   13533           0 :     }
   13534             : 
   13535           0 :     auto value() const -> double {
   13536           0 :         switch (m_units) {
   13537             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   13538           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
   13539             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   13540           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
   13541             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   13542           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
   13543             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   13544           0 :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
   13545             :         default:
   13546           0 :             return static_cast<double>(m_inNanoseconds);
   13547             :         }
   13548             :     }
   13549           0 :     auto unitsAsString() const -> std::string {
   13550           0 :         switch (m_units) {
   13551             :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
   13552           0 :             return "ns";
   13553             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   13554           0 :             return "us";
   13555             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   13556           0 :             return "ms";
   13557             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   13558           0 :             return "s";
   13559             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   13560           0 :             return "m";
   13561             :         default:
   13562           0 :             return "** internal error **";
   13563             :         }
   13564             : 
   13565             :     }
   13566           0 :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {
   13567           0 :         return os << duration.value() << " " << duration.unitsAsString();
   13568             :     }
   13569             : };

   13833           0 : struct SummaryColumn {
   13834             :

   13836           0 :     :   label( std::move( _label ) ),
   13837           0 :         colour( _colour ) {}
   13838           0 :     SummaryColumn addRow( std::size_t count ) {
   13839           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   13840           0 :         rss << count;
   13841           0 :         std::string row = rss.str();
   13842           0 :         for (auto& oldRow : rows) {
   13843           0 :             while (oldRow.size() < row.size())
   13844           0 :                 oldRow = ' ' + oldRow;
   13845           0 :             while (oldRow.size() > row.size())
   13846           0 :                 row = ' ' + row;
   13847             :         }
   13848           0 :         rows.push_back(row);
   13849           0 :         return *this;
   13850             :     }
   13851             :

   13858           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   13859           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   13860           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "No tests ran\n";
   13861           1 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed()) {
   13862           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << "All tests passed";
   13863           1 :         stream << " ("
   13864           3 :             << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << " in "
   13865           3 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") << ')'
   13866           1 :             << '\n';
   13867             :     } else {
   13868             : 
   13869           0 :         std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;
   13870             :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("", Colour::None)
   13871           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.total())
   13872           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.total()));
   13873             :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("passed", Colour::Success)
   13874           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.passed)
   13875           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.passed));
   13876             :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("failed", Colour::ResultError)
   13877           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.failed)
   13878           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.failed));
   13879             :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("failed as expected", Colour::ResultExpectedFailure)
   13880           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.failedButOk)
   13881           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.failedButOk));
   13882             : 
   13883           0 :         printSummaryRow("test cases", columns, 0);
   13884           0 :         printSummaryRow("assertions", columns, 1);
   13885             :     }
   13886           1 : }
   13887           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryRow(std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row) {
   13888           0 :     for (auto col : cols) {
   13889           0 :         std::string value = col.rows[row];
   13890           0 :         if (col.label.empty()) {
   13891           0 :             stream << label << ": ";
   13892           0 :             if (value != "0")
   13893           0 :                 stream << value;
   13894             :             else
   13895           0 :                 stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "- none -";
   13896           0 :         } else if (value != "0") {
   13897           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::LightGrey) << " | ";
   13898           0 :             stream << Colour(col.colour)
   13899           0 :                 << value << ' ' << col.label;
   13900             :         }
   13901             :     }
   13902           0 :     stream << '\n';
   13903           0 : }
   13904             : 
   13905           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
   13906           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
   13907           1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
   13908           1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
   13909           1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
   13910           1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   13911           0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)++;
   13912           3 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   13913           1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)--;
   13914             : 
   13915           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Error) << std::string(failedRatio, '=');
   13916           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultExpectedFailure) << std::string(failedButOkRatio, '=');
   13917           1 :         if (totals.testCases.allPassed())
   13918           1 :             stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   13919             :         else
   13920           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::Success) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   13921             :     } else {
   13922           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << std::string(CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=');
   13923             :     }
   13924           1 :     stream << '\n';
   13925           1 : }
   13926           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryDivider() {
   13927           0 :     stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';
   13928           0 : }

   13948           0 :         std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
   13949             :             // Beware, this is not reentrant because of backward compatibility issues
   13950             :             // Also, UTC only, again because of backward compatibility (%z is C++11)
   13951             :             time_t rawtime;
   13952           0 :             std::time(&rawtime);
   13953           0 :             auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
   13954             : 
   13955             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   13956             :             std::tm timeInfo = {};
   13957             :             gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
   13958             : #else
   13959             :             std::tm* timeInfo;
   13960           0 :             timeInfo = std::gmtime(&rawtime);
   13961             : #endif
   13962             : 
   13963             :             char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
   13964           0 :             const char * const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
   13965             : 
   13966             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   13967             :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
   13968             : #else
   13969           0 :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, timeInfo);
   13970             : #endif
   13971           0 :             return std::string(timeStamp);
   13972             :         }

   13974           0 :         std::string fileNameTag(const std::vector<std::string> &tags) {
   13975             :             auto it = std::find_if(begin(tags),
   13976             :                                    end(tags),
   13977           0 :                                    [] (std::string const& tag) {return tag.front() == '#'; });
   13978           0 :             if (it != tags.end())
   13979           0 :                 return it->substr(1);
   13980           0 :             return std::string();

   14068           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {
   14069           0 :         TestCaseStats const& stats = testCaseNode.value;
   14070             :

   14072             :         // test case itself. That section may have 0-n nested sections

   14079           0 :             className = fileNameTag(stats.testInfo.tags);

   14081           0 :                 className = "global";

   14090           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeSection(  std::string const& className,

   14104             :             }

   14106           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname", className );

   14130           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   14131           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   14132           0 :         if( !result.isOk() ) {
   14133           0 :             std::string elementName;
   14134           0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   14135             :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   14136             :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   14137           0 :                     elementName = "error";
   14138           0 :                     break;
   14139             :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   14140           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   14141           0 :                     break;
   14142             :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   14143           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   14144           0 :                     break;
   14145             :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   14146           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   14147           0 :                     break;
   14148             : 
   14149             :                 // We should never see these here:
   14150             :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   14151             :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   14152             :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   14153             :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   14154             :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   14155             :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   14156           0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   14157           0 :                     break;
   14158             :             }
   14159             : 
   14160           0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   14161             : 
   14162           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "message", result.getExpandedExpression() );
   14163           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   14164             : 
   14165           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   14166           0 :             if( !result.getMessage().empty() )
   14167           0 :                 rss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   14168           0 :             for( auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages )
   14169           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info )
   14170           0 :                     rss << msg.message << '\n';
   14171             : 
   14172           0 :             rss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();
   14173           0 :             xml.writeText( rss.str(), false );
   14174             :         }
   14175           0 :     }

   14395           0 :     void XmlReporter::assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) { }
   14396             : 
   14397           0 :     bool XmlReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
   14398             : 
   14399           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = assertionStats.assertionResult;
   14400             : 
   14401           0 :         bool includeResults = m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || !result.isOk();
   14402             : 
   14403           0 :         if( includeResults || result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   14404             :             // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
   14405           0 :             for( auto const& msg : assertionStats.infoMessages ) {
   14406           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info && includeResults ) {
   14407           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   14408           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   14409           0 :                 } else if ( msg.type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   14410           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
   14411           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   14412             :                 }
   14413             :             }
   14414             :         }
   14415             : 
   14416             :         // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
   14417           0 :         if( !includeResults && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   14418           0 :             return true;
   14419             : 
   14420             :         // Print the expression if there is one.
   14421           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   14422           0 :             m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )
   14423           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "success", result.succeeded() )

   14426           0 :             writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );

   14429           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpression() );

   14431           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpandedExpression() );
   14432             :         }
   14433             : 
   14434             :         // And... Print a result applicable to each result type.
   14435           0 :         switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   14436             :             case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   14437           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Exception" );
   14438           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   14439           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   14440           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();

   14443           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "FatalErrorCondition" );

   14445           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   14446           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   14447           0 :                 break;
   14448             :             case ResultWas::Info:
   14449           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   14450           0 :                     .writeText( result.getMessage() );
   14451           0 :                 break;
   14452             :             case ResultWas::Warning:
   14453             :                 // Warning will already have been written
   14454           0 :                 break;
   14455             :             case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   14456           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Failure" );
   14457           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   14458           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   14459           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   14460           0 :                 break;
   14461             :             default:
   14462           0 :                 break;
   14463             :         }
   14464             : 
   14465           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() )
   14466           0 :             m_xml.endElement();
   14467             : 
   14468           0 :         return true;
   14469             :     }
   14470             : 
   14471           0 :     void XmlReporter::sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) {
   14472           0 :         StreamingReporterBase::sectionEnded( sectionStats );

   14481             : 
   14482           0 :             m_xml.endElement();
   14483             :         }
   14484           0 :     }
